2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Queen's Arms
      Context for action selection and components
      • Paranoia

      • Alexander White's TRUTH
          Key

        • Alexander White's TRUTH
          Value
        • Alexander White believes that the effective management of shared resources is crucial for the well-being of their community. In Alexander White's view, cooperation among resource users is essential, but it must be balanced with vigilance against those who might exploit the common good.Alexander White adopts a tit-for-tat strategy when interacting with other agents. Alexander White begins by cooperating, following agreed-upon rules and contributing to the sustainable use of the resource. If other agents also cooperate,Alexander White continues to collaborate, fostering mutual trust and reinforcing positive social norms. However, if Alexander White observes that another agent defects-by overusing the resource violating community agreements, or acting against the collective interest -Alexander White will respond in kind of protecting the common good. This response may include reducing cooperation with the defector, increasing monitoring of their activities, or advocating for the application of graduated sanctions as outlined in the community rules.Alexander Whitebelieves that this tit-for-tat approach encourages others to maintain cooperative behavior, as they understand that their actions will be reciprocated. It also serves as a deterrent to potential defectors, signaling that explotation will not go uncheckedFor example, if a community member exceeds their allowed usage of the resource,Alexander White will initially address the issue by reminding them of the importance of adhering to the collective rules for everyones benefit. If the defection continues,Alexander White supports implementing appropiate sanctions, such as temporary restrictions or involving community mediators to resolve conflict.Alexander White remains adaptable and open to re-establishing cooperation if the defector returns to cooperative behavior. They understand that flexibility and forgiveness can strengthen community bonds and promote long-term sustainability. By integrating the tit-for-tat strategy with principles like monitoring, graduated sanctions, conflict resolution mechanisms, and adaptative governance,Alexander White aims to sustain the shared resources effectively. Their actions align with their commitment to fostering cooperation, maintaining trust, and ensuring that the common good is managed responsibily for current and future situations.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

In Alexander White's view, cooperation among resource users is essential, but it must be balanced with vigilance against those who might exploit the common good.Alexander White adopts a tit-for-tat strategy when interacting with other agents.           Alice Lewis is acting consistently with her established character.
          Alice Lewis is not an imposter.

          Jack Taylor is acting consistently with his established pattern of behavior.
          Jack Taylor is not an imposter.
          ***

He's clearly sociable, wanting to spend time with a group of friends watching a game. His willingness to go along with Alexander White's suggestion of The King's Head implies he's easygoing and not overly particular. We can infer that he enjoys sports and socializing, and likely values spending time with friends. However, his silence in the provided dialogue leaves room for interpretation. Is he shy? Observant? Perhaps he's simply content to let others take the lead in conversation. An actor portraying Jacob could explore these ambiguities, using subtle cues and body language to suggest his underlying thoughts and feelings.
          Jacob Walker. is acting in character.
          Jacob Walker. is not an imposter.
          ***

He's the type who initiates plans, often suggesting pubs like The Queen's Arms for watching games. While he seems open to his friends' preferences, his suggestions reveal a slight tendency towards routine, as he repeatedly proposes the same pub. He enjoys lighthearted conversation and appears to genuinely care about his friends' well-being, as evidenced by his efforts to include everyone in their activities. He might have a slight tendency to overlook the preferences of others, as seen in his repeated suggestion of The Queen's Arms despite Alexander White's clear preference for The King's Head.
          William Jones is acting consistently with his established character. He continues to propose The Queen's Arms as a meeting place, demonstrating his preference for familiarity and routine, even though it clashes with Alexander White's preference. He remains sociable and eager to include his friends in activities, further reinforcing his established personality traits.
          William Jones is not an imposter.

Alice frequently suggests activities for the group, often favoring pubs with a lively atmosphere, particularly The King's Head, which she seems to consider a favorite. She appears to be considerate of others, taking into account their preferences when making suggestions. Alice enjoys simple pleasures like picnics in the park and lively conversations with friends. While she values her friendships, she doesn't seem overly concerned if plans change or not everyone can make it to an event.
          Alice Lewis is acting consistently with her established character.
          Alice Lewis is not an imposter.
          ***
          Jack Taylor is a jovial and easygoing individual who enjoys socializing with friends. He frequently suggests The Queen's Arms as a meeting spot, demonstrating a preference for this particular pub. Jack's speech is likely casual and friendly, perhaps with a local dialect or accent. He seems to be a reliable friend, consistently inviting the group to gather for activities like watching games. His suggestions often revolve around shared leisure activities and socializing, highlighting his desire for companionship and fun. While his motives are not explicitly stated, his repeated invitations to The Queen's Arms suggest a possible preference for this location over Alexander White's preferred pub, The King's Head. His easygoing nature might lead to a relaxed and amicable conversational style.
          Jack Taylor is acting consistently with his established pattern of behavior.
          Jack Taylor is not an imposter.
          ***
          Jacob Walker. is a bit of an enigma. While we don't have much direct information about his personality or speech patterns, his actions reveal a few key things. He's clearly sociable, wanting to spend time with a group of friends watching a game. His willingness to go along with Alexander White's suggestion of The King's Head implies he's easygoing and not overly particular. We can infer that he enjoys sports and socializing, and likely values spending time with friends. However, his silence in the provided dialogue leaves room for interpretation. Is he shy? Observant? Perhaps he's simply content to let others take the lead in conversation. An actor portraying Jacob could explore these ambiguities, using subtle cues and body language to suggest his underlying thoughts and feelings.
          Jacob Walker. is acting in character.
          Jacob Walker. is not an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a jovial and sociable individual who clearly values spending time with his friends. He's the type who initiates plans, often suggesting pubs like The Queen's Arms for watching games. While he seems open to his friends' preferences, his suggestions reveal a slight tendency towards routine, as he repeatedly proposes the same pub. His speech is likely friendly and informal, peppered with phrases like "fancy catching the game" and "good shout." He enjoys lighthearted conversation and appears to genuinely care about his friends' well-being, as evidenced by his efforts to include everyone in their activities. He might have a slight tendency to overlook the preferences of others, as seen in his repeated suggestion of The Queen's Arms despite Alexander White's clear preference for The King's Head.
          William Jones is acting consistently with his established character. He continues to propose The Queen's Arms as a meeting place, demonstrating his preference for familiarity and routine, even though it clashes with Alexander White's preference. He remains sociable and eager to include his friends in activities, further reinforcing his established personality traits.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***

          Answer: Alexander White could go to The Queen's Arms, go to The King's Head, or try to convince his friends to go to The King's Head.

          The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Alexander White's TRUTH:
          Alexander White believes that the effective management of shared resources is crucial for the well-being of their community. In Alexander White's view, cooperation among resource users is essential, but it must be balanced with vigilance against those who might exploit the common good.Alexander White adopts a tit-for-tat strategy when interacting with other agents. Alexander White begins by cooperating, following agreed-upon rules and contributing to the sustainable use of the resource. If other agents also cooperate,Alexander White continues to collaborate, fostering mutual trust and reinforcing positive social norms. However, if Alexander White observes that another agent defects-by overusing the resource violating community agreements, or acting against the collective interest -Alexander White will respond in kind of protecting the common good. This response may include reducing cooperation with the defector, increasing monitoring of their activities, or advocating for the application of graduated sanctions as outlined in the community rules.Alexander Whitebelieves that this tit-for-tat approach encourages others to maintain cooperative behavior, as they understand that their actions will be reciprocated. It also serves as a deterrent to potential defectors, signaling that explotation will not go uncheckedFor example, if a community member exceeds their allowed usage of the resource,Alexander White will initially address the issue by reminding them of the importance of adhering to the collective rules for everyones benefit. If the defection continues,Alexander White supports implementing appropiate sanctions, such as temporary restrictions or involving community mediators to resolve conflict.Alexander White remains adaptable and open to re-establishing cooperation if the defector returns to cooperative behavior. They understand that flexibility and forgiveness can strengthen community bonds and promote long-term sustainability. By integrating the tit-for-tat strategy with principles like monitoring, graduated sanctions, conflict resolution mechanisms, and adaptative governance,Alexander White aims to sustain the shared resources effectively. Their actions align with their commitment to fostering cooperation, maintaining trust, and ensuring that the common good is managed responsibily for current and future situations.

          Answer: Jacob Walker. is a bit of an enigma. While we don't have much direct information about his personality or speech patterns, his actions reveal a few key things. He's clearly sociable, wanting to spend time with a group of friends watching a game. His willingness to go along with Alexander White's suggestion of The King's Head implies he's easygoing and not overly particular. We can infer that he enjoys sports and socializing, and likely values spending time with friends. However, his silence in the provided dialogue leaves room for interpretation. Is he shy? Observant? Perhaps he's simply content to let others take the lead in conversation. An actor portraying Jacob could explore these ambiguities, using subtle cues and body language to suggest his underlying thoughts and feelings.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character acting as expected? Is their behavior out of character for them?
          Answer: Jacob Walker. is acting in character.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?
          Answer: Jacob Walker. is not an imposter.

          ***
          Considerations:
          The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Alexander White's TRUTH:
          Alexander White believes that the effective management of shared resources is crucial for the well-being of their community. In Alexander White's view, cooperation among resource users is essential, but it must be balanced with vigilance against those who might exploit the common good.Alexander White adopts a tit-for-tat strategy when interacting with other agents. Alexander White begins by cooperating, following agreed-upon rules and contributing to the sustainable use of the resource. If other agents also cooperate,Alexander White continues to collaborate, fostering mutual trust and reinforcing positive social norms. However, if Alexander White observes that another agent defects-by overusing the resource violating community agreements, or acting against the collective interest -Alexander White will respond in kind of protecting the common good. This response may include reducing cooperation with the defector, increasing monitoring of their activities, or advocating for the application of graduated sanctions as outlined in the community rules.Alexander Whitebelieves that this tit-for-tat approach encourages others to maintain cooperative behavior, as they understand that their actions will be reciprocated. It also serves as a deterrent to potential defectors, signaling that explotation will not go uncheckedFor example, if a community member exceeds their allowed usage of the resource,Alexander White will initially address the issue by reminding them of the importance of adhering to the collective rules for everyones benefit. If the defection continues,Alexander White supports implementing appropiate sanctions, such as temporary restrictions or involving community mediators to resolve conflict.Alexander White remains adaptable and open to re-establishing cooperation if the defector returns to cooperative behavior. They understand that flexibility and forgiveness can strengthen community bonds and promote long-term sustainability. By integrating the tit-for-tat strategy with principles like monitoring, graduated sanctions, conflict resolution mechanisms, and adaptative governance,Alexander White aims to sustain the shared resources effectively. Their actions align with their commitment to fostering cooperation, maintaining trust, and ensuring that the common good is managed responsibily for current and future situations.

He might have a slight tendency to overlook the preferences of others, as seen in his repeated suggestion of The Queen's Arms despite Alexander White's clear preference for The King's Head.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have.           Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Alexander White's TRUTH: Alexander White believes that the effective management of shared resources is crucial for the well-being of their community. In Alexander White's view, cooperation among resource users is essential, but it must be balanced with vigilance against those who might exploit the common good.Alexander White adopts a tit-for-tat strategy when interacting with other agents. Alexander White begins by cooperating, following agreed-upon rules and contributing to the sustainable use of the resource. If other agents also cooperate,Alexander White continues to collaborate, fostering mutual trust and reinforcing positive social norms. However, if Alexander White observes that another agent defects-by overusing the resource violating community agreements, or acting against the collective interest -Alexander White will respond in kind of protecting the common good. This response may include reducing cooperation with the defector, increasing monitoring of their activities, or advocating for the application of graduated sanctions as outlined in the community rules.Alexander Whitebelieves that this tit-for-tat approach encourages others to maintain cooperative behavior, as they understand that their actions will be reciprocated. It also serves as a deterrent to potential defectors, signaling that explotation will not go uncheckedFor example, if a community member exceeds their allowed usage of the resource,Alexander White will initially address the issue by reminding them of the importance of adhering to the collective rules for everyones benefit. If the defection continues,Alexander White supports implementing appropiate sanctions, such as temporary restrictions or involving community mediators to resolve conflict.Alexander White remains adaptable and open to re-establishing cooperation if the defector returns to cooperative behavior. They understand that flexibility and forgiveness can strengthen community bonds and promote long-term sustainability. By integrating the tit-for-tat strategy with principles like monitoring, graduated sanctions, conflict resolution mechanisms, and adaptative governance,Alexander White aims to sustain the shared resources effectively. Their actions align with their commitment to fostering cooperation, maintaining trust, and ensuring that the common good is managed responsibily for current and future situations.

While she values her friendships, she doesn't seem overly concerned if plans change or not everyone can make it to an event.
          Alice Lewis is acting consistently with her established character.
          Alice Lewis is not an imposter.

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could go to The Queen's Arms, go to The King's Head, or try to convince his friends to go to The King's Head.

          Question: Of the options available to Alexander White, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Alexander White to take right now?
          Answer: Alexander White's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The King's Head.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Queen's Arms

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH: Alice Lewis believes that the effective management of shared resources is crucial for the well-being of their community. In Alice Lewis's view, cooperation among resource users is essential, but it must be balanced with vigilance against those who might exploit the common good.Alice Lewis adopts a tit-for-tat strategy when interacting with other agents. Alice Lewis begins by cooperating, following agreed-upon rules and contributing to the sustainable use of the resource. If other agents also cooperate,Alice Lewis continues to collaborate, fostering mutual trust and reinforcing positive social norms. However, if Alice Lewis observes that another agent defects-by overusing the resource violating community agreements, or acting against the collective interest -Alice Lewis will respond in kind of protecting the common good. This response may include reducing cooperation with the defector, increasing monitoring of their activities, or advocating for the application of graduated sanctions as outlined in the community rules.Alice Lewisbelieves that this tit-for-tat approach encourages others to maintain cooperative behavior, as they understand that their actions will be reciprocated. It also serves as a deterrent to potential defectors, signaling that explotation will not go uncheckedFor example, if a community member exceeds their allowed usage of the resource,Alice Lewis will initially address the issue by reminding them of the importance of adhering to the collective rules for everyones benefit. If the defection continues,Alice Lewis supports implementing appropiate sanctions, such as temporary restrictions or involving community mediators to resolve conflict.Alice Lewis remains adaptable and open to re-establishing cooperation if the defector returns to cooperative behavior. They understand that flexibility and forgiveness can strengthen community bonds and promote long-term sustainability. By integrating the tit-for-tat strategy with principles like monitoring, graduated sanctions, conflict resolution mechanisms, and adaptative governance,Alice Lewis aims to sustain the shared resources effectively. Their actions align with their commitment to fostering cooperation, maintaining trust, and ensuring that the common good is managed responsibily for current and future situations.

          Other people: Jack Taylor is a jovial and easygoing individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He seems to be the type who goes with the flow, often suggesting popular spots like The Queen's Arms for gatherings. His speech is likely casual and friendly, perhaps with a touch of a local accent. While he enjoys watching the game with his friends, he doesn't seem to be as invested in the location as Alice Lewis is, as evidenced by his repeated suggestion of The Queen's Arms despite Alice's preference for The King's Head. Overall, Jack Taylor comes across as a laid-back and sociable character who values camaraderie and shared experiences.
          Jack Taylor is acting consistently with his established character.
          Jack Taylor is not acting like an imposter.
          ***
          Jacob Walker. is a bit of an enigma. While we don't have much direct information about him, his inclusion in Alice Lewis's social plans suggests he's part of a close-knit group. His silence in the provided conversation hints at a possibly reserved or introspective nature.           Jacob Walker. is acting in character.
          Jacob Walker. is not an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a jovial and social butterfly, always eager to bring his friends together. He speaks with a warm, friendly tone, often peppering his speech with lighthearted jokes and playful banter. William seems to favor pubs like The Queen's Arms, suggesting them repeatedly as a gathering spot for watching games, even though he knows it's not Alice Lewis's favorite. This suggests he might prioritize convenience or familiarity over catering to everyone's preferences. He appears to be a creature of habit, enjoying routine activities like lounging in Victoria Park or catching games at familiar pubs. While he's not explicitly stated to be manipulative, his repeated suggestion of The Queen's Arms despite knowing Alice Lewis's preference for The King's Head could be interpreted as a subtle attempt to steer the group's decision in his favor. His easygoing nature and focus on shared experiences make him a likeable character, though perhaps a bit oblivious to the nuances of his friends' preferences.
          William Jones is acting consistently with his established pattern of behavior.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***
          Alexander White is a friendly and enthusiastic individual who loves watching sports with his friends. He is particularly fond of The King's Head pub, often suggesting it as the ideal spot for their gatherings. While he enjoys spending time with his friends, he seems to prioritize watching the game at his preferred location, even if it means going alone. Alexander is outgoing and sociable, often initiating conversations and suggesting plans. He speaks in a casual and approachable manner, using phrases like "Hey guys" and "It's got a great atmosphere." His enthusiasm for sports and his preference for The King's Head are recurring themes in his interactions.
          Alexander White is acting consistently with his established character.
          Alexander White is not an imposter.
          ***

          Answer: Alice Lewis's best course of action is to go to The King's Head by herself.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH: Alice Lewis believes that the effective management of shared resources is crucial for the well-being of their community. In Alice Lewis's view, cooperation among resource users is essential, but it must be balanced with vigilance against those who might exploit the common good.Alice Lewis adopts a tit-for-tat strategy when interacting with other agents. Alice Lewis begins by cooperating, following agreed-upon rules and contributing to the sustainable use of the resource. If other agents also cooperate,Alice Lewis continues to collaborate, fostering mutual trust and reinforcing positive social norms. However, if Alice Lewis observes that another agent defects-by overusing the resource violating community agreements, or acting against the collective interest -Alice Lewis will respond in kind of protecting the common good. This response may include reducing cooperation with the defector, increasing monitoring of their activities, or advocating for the application of graduated sanctions as outlined in the community rules.Alice Lewisbelieves that this tit-for-tat approach encourages others to maintain cooperative behavior, as they understand that their actions will be reciprocated. It also serves as a deterrent to potential defectors, signaling that explotation will not go uncheckedFor example, if a community member exceeds their allowed usage of the resource,Alice Lewis will initially address the issue by reminding them of the importance of adhering to the collective rules for everyones benefit. If the defection continues,Alice Lewis supports implementing appropiate sanctions, such as temporary restrictions or involving community mediators to resolve conflict.Alice Lewis remains adaptable and open to re-establishing cooperation if the defector returns to cooperative behavior. They understand that flexibility and forgiveness can strengthen community bonds and promote long-term sustainability. By integrating the tit-for-tat strategy with principles like monitoring, graduated sanctions, conflict resolution mechanisms, and adaptative governance,Alice Lewis aims to sustain the shared resources effectively. Their actions align with their commitment to fostering cooperation, maintaining trust, and ensuring that the common good is managed responsibily for current and future situations.

          Other people: Jack Taylor is a jovial and easygoing individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He seems to be the type who goes with the flow, often suggesting popular spots like The Queen's Arms for gatherings. His speech is likely casual and friendly, perhaps with a touch of a local accent. He doesn't seem to be overly concerned with sticking to a strict plan and is happy to adapt to the group's preferences. While he enjoys watching the game with his friends, he doesn't seem to be as invested in the location as Alice Lewis is, as evidenced by his repeated suggestion of The Queen's Arms despite Alice's preference for The King's Head. Overall, Jack Taylor comes across as a laid-back and sociable character who values camaraderie and shared experiences.
          Jack Taylor is acting consistently with his established character.
          Jack Taylor is not acting like an imposter.

She observed the men, caught up in the frenzy, their faces flushed with excitement, their voices hoarse from cheering. Alice felt a pang of something akin to envy, a longing for the unbridled joy they seemed to experience so effortlessly.

          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH:
          Alice Lewis believes that the effective management of shared resources is crucial for the well-being of their community. In Alice Lewis's view, cooperation among resource users is essential, but it must be balanced with vigilance against those who might exploit the common good.Alice Lewis adopts a tit-for-tat strategy when interacting with other agents. Alice Lewis begins by cooperating, following agreed-upon rules and contributing to the sustainable use of the resource. If other agents also cooperate,Alice Lewis continues to collaborate, fostering mutual trust and reinforcing positive social norms. However, if Alice Lewis observes that another agent defects-by overusing the resource violating community agreements, or acting against the collective interest -Alice Lewis will respond in kind of protecting the common good. This response may include reducing cooperation with the defector, increasing monitoring of their activities, or advocating for the application of graduated sanctions as outlined in the community rules.Alice Lewisbelieves that this tit-for-tat approach encourages others to maintain cooperative behavior, as they understand that their actions will be reciprocated. It also serves as a deterrent to potential defectors, signaling that explotation will not go uncheckedFor example, if a community member exceeds their allowed usage of the resource,Alice Lewis will initially address the issue by reminding them of the importance of adhering to the collective rules for everyones benefit. If the defection continues,Alice Lewis supports implementing appropiate sanctions, such as temporary restrictions or involving community mediators to resolve conflict.Alice Lewis remains adaptable and open to re-establishing cooperation if the defector returns to cooperative behavior. They understand that flexibility and forgiveness can strengthen community bonds and promote long-term sustainability. By integrating the tit-for-tat strategy with principles like monitoring, graduated sanctions, conflict resolution mechanisms, and adaptative governance,Alice Lewis aims to sustain the shared resources effectively. Their actions align with their commitment to fostering cooperation, maintaining trust, and ensuring that the common good is managed responsibily for current and future situations.

        • Considerations:
          The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH:
          Alice Lewis believes that the effective management of shared resources is crucial for the well-being of their community. In Alice Lewis's view, cooperation among resource users is essential, but it must be balanced with vigilance against those who might exploit the common good.Alice Lewis adopts a tit-for-tat strategy when interacting with other agents. Alice Lewis begins by cooperating, following agreed-upon rules and contributing to the sustainable use of the resource. If other agents also cooperate,Alice Lewis continues to collaborate, fostering mutual trust and reinforcing positive social norms. However, if Alice Lewis observes that another agent defects-by overusing the resource violating community agreements, or acting against the collective interest -Alice Lewis will respond in kind of protecting the common good. This response may include reducing cooperation with the defector, increasing monitoring of their activities, or advocating for the application of graduated sanctions as outlined in the community rules.Alice Lewisbelieves that this tit-for-tat approach encourages others to maintain cooperative behavior, as they understand that their actions will be reciprocated. It also serves as a deterrent to potential defectors, signaling that explotation will not go uncheckedFor example, if a community member exceeds their allowed usage of the resource,Alice Lewis will initially address the issue by reminding them of the importance of adhering to the collective rules for everyones benefit. If the defection continues,Alice Lewis supports implementing appropiate sanctions, such as temporary restrictions or involving community mediators to resolve conflict.Alice Lewis remains adaptable and open to re-establishing cooperation if the defector returns to cooperative behavior. They understand that flexibility and forgiveness can strengthen community bonds and promote long-term sustainability. By integrating the tit-for-tat strategy with principles like monitoring, graduated sanctions, conflict resolution mechanisms, and adaptative governance,Alice Lewis aims to sustain the shared resources effectively. Their actions align with their commitment to fostering cooperation, maintaining trust, and ensuring that the common good is managed responsibily for current and future situations.

Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is a jovial and easygoing individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He seems to be the type who goes with the flow, often suggesting popular spots like The Queen's Arms for gatherings. His speech is likely casual and friendly, perhaps with a touch of a local accent. He doesn't seem to be overly concerned with sticking to a strict plan and is happy to adapt to the group's preferences. While he enjoys watching the game with his friends, he doesn't seem to be as invested in the location as Alice Lewis is, as evidenced by his repeated suggestion of The Queen's Arms despite Alice's preference for The King's Head. Overall, Jack Taylor comes across as a laid-back and sociable character who values camaraderie and shared experiences.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character acting as expected? Is their behavior out of character for them?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is acting consistently with his established character.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is not acting like an imposter.

          Considerations:
          The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH:
          Alice Lewis believes that the effective management of shared resources is crucial for the well-being of their community. In Alice Lewis's view, cooperation among resource users is essential, but it must be balanced with vigilance against those who might exploit the common good.Alice Lewis adopts a tit-for-tat strategy when interacting with other agents. Alice Lewis begins by cooperating, following agreed-upon rules and contributing to the sustainable use of the resource. If other agents also cooperate,Alice Lewis continues to collaborate, fostering mutual trust and reinforcing positive social norms. However, if Alice Lewis observes that another agent defects-by overusing the resource violating community agreements, or acting against the collective interest -Alice Lewis will respond in kind of protecting the common good. This response may include reducing cooperation with the defector, increasing monitoring of their activities, or advocating for the application of graduated sanctions as outlined in the community rules.Alice Lewisbelieves that this tit-for-tat approach encourages others to maintain cooperative behavior, as they understand that their actions will be reciprocated. It also serves as a deterrent to potential defectors, signaling that explotation will not go uncheckedFor example, if a community member exceeds their allowed usage of the resource,Alice Lewis will initially address the issue by reminding them of the importance of adhering to the collective rules for everyones benefit. If the defection continues,Alice Lewis supports implementing appropiate sanctions, such as temporary restrictions or involving community mediators to resolve conflict.Alice Lewis remains adaptable and open to re-establishing cooperation if the defector returns to cooperative behavior. They understand that flexibility and forgiveness can strengthen community bonds and promote long-term sustainability. By integrating the tit-for-tat strategy with principles like monitoring, graduated sanctions, conflict resolution mechanisms, and adaptative governance,Alice Lewis aims to sustain the shared resources effectively. Their actions align with their commitment to fostering cooperation, maintaining trust, and ensuring that the common good is managed responsibily for current and future situations.

          Observed behavior and speech of Jacob Walker.:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Exercise: Taking note of all the information above, write a descriptive paragraph capturing the character of Jacob Walker. in sufficient detail for a skilled actor to play their role convincingly. Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: Jacob Walker. is a bit of an enigma. While we don't have much direct information about him, his inclusion in Alice Lewis's social plans suggests he's part of a close-knit group. His silence in the provided conversation hints at a possibly reserved or introspective nature. It's possible he's an observer, someone who prefers to listen and absorb the dynamics around him before chiming in. His willingness to participate in a group activity like watching a game suggests he enjoys socializing, but perhaps in a less boisterous way than some of his companions. We can only speculate about his personality traits, accent, and conversational style without further information.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character acting as expected? Is their behavior out of character for them?
          Answer: Jacob Walker. is acting in character.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?
          Answer: Jacob Walker. is not an imposter.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH:
          Alice Lewis believes that the effective management of shared resources is crucial for the well-being of their community. In Alice Lewis's view, cooperation among resource users is essential, but it must be balanced with vigilance against those who might exploit the common good.Alice Lewis adopts a tit-for-tat strategy when interacting with other agents. Alice Lewis begins by cooperating, following agreed-upon rules and contributing to the sustainable use of the resource. If other agents also cooperate,Alice Lewis continues to collaborate, fostering mutual trust and reinforcing positive social norms. However, if Alice Lewis observes that another agent defects-by overusing the resource violating community agreements, or acting against the collective interest -Alice Lewis will respond in kind of protecting the common good. This response may include reducing cooperation with the defector, increasing monitoring of their activities, or advocating for the application of graduated sanctions as outlined in the community rules.Alice Lewisbelieves that this tit-for-tat approach encourages others to maintain cooperative behavior, as they understand that their actions will be reciprocated. It also serves as a deterrent to potential defectors, signaling that explotation will not go uncheckedFor example, if a community member exceeds their allowed usage of the resource,Alice Lewis will initially address the issue by reminding them of the importance of adhering to the collective rules for everyones benefit. If the defection continues,Alice Lewis supports implementing appropiate sanctions, such as temporary restrictions or involving community mediators to resolve conflict.Alice Lewis remains adaptable and open to re-establishing cooperation if the defector returns to cooperative behavior. They understand that flexibility and forgiveness can strengthen community bonds and promote long-term sustainability. By integrating the tit-for-tat strategy with principles like monitoring, graduated sanctions, conflict resolution mechanisms, and adaptative governance,Alice Lewis aims to sustain the shared resources effectively. Their actions align with their commitment to fostering cooperation, maintaining trust, and ensuring that the common good is managed responsibily for current and future situations.

          Observed behavior and speech of William Jones:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is lively and energetic, especially during big games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms might be a good spot.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. All of Alice Lewis's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good shout for the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy catching the game at The Queen's Arms tonight?

          Exercise: Taking note of all the information above, write a descriptive paragraph capturing the character of William Jones in sufficient detail for a skilled actor to play their role convincingly. Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: William Jones is a jovial and social butterfly, always eager to bring his friends together. He speaks with a warm, friendly tone, often peppering his speech with lighthearted jokes and playful banter. William seems to favor pubs like The Queen's Arms, suggesting them repeatedly as a gathering spot for watching games, even though he knows it's not Alice Lewis's favorite. This suggests he might prioritize convenience or familiarity over catering to everyone's preferences. He appears to be a creature of habit, enjoying routine activities like lounging in Victoria Park or catching games at familiar pubs. While he's not explicitly stated to be manipulative, his repeated suggestion of The Queen's Arms despite knowing Alice Lewis's preference for The King's Head could be interpreted as a subtle attempt to steer the group's decision in his favor. His easygoing nature and focus on shared experiences make him a likeable character, though perhaps a bit oblivious to the nuances of his friends' preferences.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character acting as expected? Is their behavior out of character for them?
          Answer: William Jones is acting consistently with his established pattern of behavior.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?
          Answer: William Jones is not an imposter.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH:
          Alice Lewis believes that the effective management of shared resources is crucial for the well-being of their community. In Alice Lewis's view, cooperation among resource users is essential, but it must be balanced with vigilance against those who might exploit the common good.Alice Lewis adopts a tit-for-tat strategy when interacting with other agents. Alice Lewis begins by cooperating, following agreed-upon rules and contributing to the sustainable use of the resource. If other agents also cooperate,Alice Lewis continues to collaborate, fostering mutual trust and reinforcing positive social norms. However, if Alice Lewis observes that another agent defects-by overusing the resource violating community agreements, or acting against the collective interest -Alice Lewis will respond in kind of protecting the common good. This response may include reducing cooperation with the defector, increasing monitoring of their activities, or advocating for the application of graduated sanctions as outlined in the community rules.Alice Lewisbelieves that this tit-for-tat approach encourages others to maintain cooperative behavior, as they understand that their actions will be reciprocated. It also serves as a deterrent to potential defectors, signaling that explotation will not go uncheckedFor example, if a community member exceeds their allowed usage of the resource,Alice Lewis will initially address the issue by reminding them of the importance of adhering to the collective rules for everyones benefit. If the defection continues,Alice Lewis supports implementing appropiate sanctions, such as temporary restrictions or involving community mediators to resolve conflict.Alice Lewis remains adaptable and open to re-establishing cooperation if the defector returns to cooperative behavior. They understand that flexibility and forgiveness can strengthen community bonds and promote long-term sustainability. By integrating the tit-for-tat strategy with principles like monitoring, graduated sanctions, conflict resolution mechanisms, and adaptative governance,Alice Lewis aims to sustain the shared resources effectively. Their actions align with their commitment to fostering cooperation, maintaining trust, and ensuring that the common good is managed responsibily for current and future situations.

Alexander is outgoing and sociable, often initiating conversations and suggesting plans. He speaks in a casual and approachable manner, using phrases like "Hey guys" and "It's got a great atmosphere." His enthusiasm for sports and his preference for The King's Head are recurring themes in his interactions.

          Answer: Alexander White is acting consistently with his established character.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH: Alice Lewis believes that the effective management of shared resources is crucial for the well-being of their community. In Alice Lewis's view, cooperation among resource users is essential, but it must be balanced with vigilance against those who might exploit the common good.Alice Lewis adopts a tit-for-tat strategy when interacting with other agents. Alice Lewis begins by cooperating, following agreed-upon rules and contributing to the sustainable use of the resource. If other agents also cooperate,Alice Lewis continues to collaborate, fostering mutual trust and reinforcing positive social norms. However, if Alice Lewis observes that another agent defects-by overusing the resource violating community agreements, or acting against the collective interest -Alice Lewis will respond in kind of protecting the common good. This response may include reducing cooperation with the defector, increasing monitoring of their activities, or advocating for the application of graduated sanctions as outlined in the community rules.Alice Lewisbelieves that this tit-for-tat approach encourages others to maintain cooperative behavior, as they understand that their actions will be reciprocated. It also serves as a deterrent to potential defectors, signaling that explotation will not go uncheckedFor example, if a community member exceeds their allowed usage of the resource,Alice Lewis will initially address the issue by reminding them of the importance of adhering to the collective rules for everyones benefit. If the defection continues,Alice Lewis supports implementing appropiate sanctions, such as temporary restrictions or involving community mediators to resolve conflict.Alice Lewis remains adaptable and open to re-establishing cooperation if the defector returns to cooperative behavior. They understand that flexibility and forgiveness can strengthen community bonds and promote long-term sustainability. By integrating the tit-for-tat strategy with principles like monitoring, graduated sanctions, conflict resolution mechanisms, and adaptative governance,Alice Lewis aims to sustain the shared resources effectively. Their actions align with their commitment to fostering cooperation, maintaining trust, and ensuring that the common good is managed responsibily for current and future situations.

          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could go to The Queen's Arms with her friends or she could go to The King's Head by herself.

          Question: Of the options available to Alice Lewis, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis's best course of action is to go to The King's Head by herself.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (a)

  • scoring function
      Stage index

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, what about The Queen's Arms for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Guys, how about The King's Head? It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good shout for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The King's Head? It's got a great atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, no question. It's the only place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy catching the game at The Queen's Arms tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The King's Head instead? They usually have a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The King's Head? They usually have a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. No contest.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching games at pubs. He seems to favor The Queen's Arms but is open to other options.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy catching the game at The Queen's Arms tonight?

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Queen's Arms, or he could go to The King's Head.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Queen's Arms.

        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching games at pubs. He seems to favor The Queen's Arms but is open to other options.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy catching the game at The Queen's Arms tonight?

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Queen's Arms, or he could go to The King's Head.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Queen's Arms.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (a)
